reference.shortdesc:
The hasNarrower element specifies that the contained subjects have a narrower focus than the container subject.I'm not sure whether to take that "not specified" sentence as a statement that we don't know what this element is, or merely stating that you can use your own definition / scope for "narrower"? If the former, we should consider removing the element. If the latter, I think it should be moved to "Usage information".
The following is what the DITA 1.2 spec said: For subjects within the <hasNarrower> element, the container subject is more general than each of the contained subjects. That is, this element makes the default hierarchical relationship explicit, although the way in which a relationship is narrower is not specified.

section.title: Usage information
section.p: The container subject is more general than the subjects contained within the hasNarrowerelement. The way in which the contained subjects represent a narrow relationship is not specified.

section.title: Specialization hierarchy
section.p: The hasNarrower element is specialized from topicref. It is defined in the subject scheme module.
